comment: She is really nice and available for office hours, although limited since she was a part time professor. Daily participation points with i-clicker and easy 80 points from homework in MasteringBiology. I didn't have any problems with the class. We are in college so expect to read the chapters and study, it is a lot of material.

This class is easy if you actually study for it. She will not go over absolutely everything in class (because there is so much content), but will go over whats important. She also provides you many ways to make an A. The homework is almost a free 80 points, the tests come straight from the website, and she gives points for attendance. Easy class!
Davis is a nice woman but a terrible professor. Her lectures are no help so get ready to teach yourself. Attendance is mandatory. Do not take this teacher if you can avoid it.

You're better off teaching yourself. Breezes through power points, which she doesn't know the material one because they aren't hers. Her tests are very detailed and you have to read the chapter outlines, read the powerpoints, read the book, and everything else that's given to even have a chance on the tests. iClicker for participation points. AVOID

You teach yourself. Read EVERTHING! Do the homework she assigned through MasteringBiology. Read the book. Read her powerpoints, outlines, reading guides, everything. She uses the iClickers to take attendance, so GET ONE!

I was not a fan of this class or the teacher. She basically just chats during class, giving a vague outline of the material. Her tests, however, are very detail oriented and go over little to nothing of what she teaches in class. You must read the book and do all the homework (which is due every class period). This was the first class I dropped.

Dr. Davis is better in lab than she is in class. I would recommend skipping class and reading the chapters and doing the reading guides provided before the tests. This class is not easy, you will have to work for your grade. She isn't very clear and is VERY prone to irrelevant tangents. If you read, you'll be fine.

She's okay. I thought the class was pretty easy. She didn't teach anything you can't get in the book the night before, so I skipped a good bit. She was very helpful in lab though, you can tell she prefers lab to lecture. The labs are a cake walk except maybe the last one. They're barely even weighted anyway. Tests are almost completely MC, & she gives bonus Qs. 3 tests and a final + labs + 2 current bio events papers (easy)= final grade. I'd probably take her again.

Lets just say that I am contemplating in pursuing biology because of her. She does not make it fun or interesting. She tends to cover only one topic during lecture and it does not help for exams. She is vague about exam topics! Book is mandatory! Exam does cover a lot. She has a PhD, but doesn't know how to work computers. Try to avoid her!

Well, she is a nice lady but a terrible teacher. Lecture is pointless, just study the book. Don't wait until the night before to study because tests cover A LOT. She is okay for lab but she doesn't even mention 80% of what is on the test in class. I really wish there had been reviews on her before I chose to take her:( AVOID.

She is very prone to tangents...long ones, that take up precious class time. She won't answer important questions, and if she does, its a vague answer. She contradicts herself a lot. I found that class was pointless, reading the book and studying the hw was the only way to pass. 4 tests with 53 questions, 1 short answer, and hw make up your grade.

Lectures can be all over the place. Gets off topic very easily. Sometimes she won't answer questions in a direct way. Test seem harder than what she makes it out to be. No study guides. Reading guidelines for each ch though. Mastering Bio required. Usually never learn last ch before test & you have to teach yourself bc we ran out of lecture time.
